t: Prayer that the Lord Will Restore Favor to the Land
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
Lord,*spn You have been favorable to Your land; You*ld have brought back the captivity of Jacob.
You*ld have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; You*ld have covered all their sin. Selah*ipg
You*ld have taken away all Your wrath; You*ld have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.
Restore*ln us, O God of our salvation, And*ld cause Your anger toward us to cease.
Will*ld You be angry with us forever? Will*ld You prolong Your anger to all generations?
Will*ld You not revive us again, That*ld Your people may rejoice in You?
Show*ld us Your mercy, Lord,*s And*ld grant us Your salvation.
I*ln will hear what God the Lord*s will speak, For*ld He will speak peace To*ld His people and to His saints; But*ld let them not turn back to folly.
Surely*ld His salvation is*i near to those who fear Him, That*ld glory may dwell in our land.
Mercy*ln and truth have met together; Righteousness*ld and peace have kissed.
Truth*ld shall spring out of the earth, And*ld righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Yes,*ld the Lord*s will give what*i is*i good; And*ld our land will yield its increase.
Righteousness*ld will go before Him, And*ld shall make His footsteps our*i pathway.
